overview: This subject examines the physiological and acoustical factors that combine to make a classical vocal sound and how these factors can support the development of vocal technique.
Through both lectures and practical exploration the subject explores the nexus between vocal physiology and artistry from both theoretical and practical perspectives.

assessments.description: Critical appraisal on theoretical content outlined in subject objectives. 1000 words
assessments.timing: Second half of the teaching period

assessments.description: Reflective journal of on the practical experience of the student's learning as outlined in the subject objectives. 1000 words
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 75% of all scheduled classes.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour workshop per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
